models

Class EventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.EventHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EventHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class provides methods for event handling. Every instance of this class contains a reference to the associated set of events.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventHandler()
      Constructs a new event handler with an empty event set.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(Event e)
      Adds a given event to the associated event set.
      EventSet addSet(EventSet newEvents)
      Tries to add an EventSet to this handler.
      EventSet all()
      Creates and returns new event set containing all events in the associated event set.
      EventSet between(java.util.Calendar startTime, java.util.Calendar endTime)
      Returns an EventSet of Events that are between startTime and endTime.
      static EventSet importEventSet(java.lang.String pathname)
      Imports event set from file with a given path.
      EventSet overlapping(java.util.Calendar startTime, java.util.Calendar endTime)
      Returns a subset of the associated EventSet that overlaps with whole-day interval given by parameters.
      void removeEvent(Event e)
      Removes a given event from the associated event set.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns string representation of this event handler.

    • Method Detail

      • all

        public EventSet all()
        Creates and returns new event set containing all events in the associated event set.
        See Also:
        EventSet.all()

      • between

        public EventSet between(java.util.Calendar startTime,
               java.util.Calendar endTime)
        Returns an EventSet of Events that are between startTime and endTime.
        See Also:
        EventSet.between(Calendar, Calendar)

      • overlapping

        public EventSet overlapping(java.util.Calendar startTime,
                   java.util.Calendar endTime)
        Returns a subset of the associated EventSet that overlaps with whole-day interval given by parameters.
        See Also:
        EventSet.overlapping(Calendar, Calendar)

      • add

        public boolean add(Event e)
        Adds a given event to the associated event set.
        Parameters:
        e - the event to be added.
        Returns:
        true if the set did not already contain the specified event.
        See Also:
        HashSet.add(Object)

      • removeEvent

        public void removeEvent(Event e)
        Removes a given event from the associated event set.
        Parameters:
        e - the event to be removed.
        See Also:
        HashSet.remove(Object)

      • addSet

        public EventSet addSet(EventSet newEvents)
        Tries to add an EventSet to this handler. All overlapping events will be returned.
        Parameters:
        newEvents - Events to add to this handler.
        Returns:
        EventSet of overlapping events.

      • importEventSet

        public static EventSet importEventSet(java.lang.String pathname)
        Imports event set from file with a given path.
        Parameters:
        pathname - the given path.
        Returns:
        imported event set if reading was successful, null otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns string representation of this event handler.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of this event handler.
